hints_html:
In part (d) we found that, in order for p(x) to have zero slope at x = 0 and x = 2 and pass through the given points, the coefficients \(\mathbf{a} = s_1\mathbf{a}_1 + s_2\mathbf{a}_2\) would need to satisfy

\[\begin{aligned} \begin{bmatrix} -4 &1 \\ -2& 1\\ 0& 1 \end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix} s_1 \\ s_2 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 2\\ 2\\ 1 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

How can we find the least square solution of the system Cs = c above?

The least square solution s satisfies

\[\begin{aligned} C^TC \mathbf s = C^T \mathbf c\end{aligned}\]

question: 1 (e)
statement_html:
In this question we will work with polynomials of degree 3 written

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle p(x) = a_1x^3 + a_2x^2 + a_3x + a_4\end{aligned}\]

(e) Write down the MATLAB/OCTAVE code that plots the points (0,1), (1,2) and (2,2) and the polynomial p(x) that

(i) has zero slopes at x = 0 and x = 2,

(ii) comes closest in the least square sense to passing through the points (0,1), (1,2) and (2,2).
